trans-unit.source: Back up Azure virtual machines | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up Azure virtual machines | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Discover, register, and back up your virtual machines with these procedures for Azure virtual machine backup.
trans-unit.target: Discover, register, and back up your virtual machines with these procedures for Azure virtual machine backup.

trans-unit.source: Back up Azure virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Back up Azure virtual machines

trans-unit.source: This article provides the procedures for how to back up your Azure virtual machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: This article provides the procedures for how to back up your Azure virtual machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: First, there are a few things you need to take care of before you can back up an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: First, there are a few things you need to take care of before you can back up an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, complete the [prerequisites](backup-azure-vms-prepare.md) to prepare your environment for backing up your VMs.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, complete the [prerequisites](backup-azure-vms-prepare.md) to prepare your environment for backing up your VMs.

trans-unit.source: For additional information, see the articles on [planning your VM backup infrastructure in Azure](backup-azure-vms-introduction.md) and [Azure virtual machines](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-machines/).
trans-unit.target: For additional information, see the articles on [planning your VM backup infrastructure in Azure](backup-azure-vms-introduction.md) and [Azure virtual machines](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-machines/).

trans-unit.source: Backing up Azure virtual machines involves three key steps:
trans-unit.target: Backing up Azure virtual machines involves three key steps:

trans-unit.source: Three steps to back up an Azure IaaS VM
trans-unit.target: Three steps to back up an Azure IaaS VM

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Backing up virtual machines is a local process.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Backing up virtual machines is a local process.

trans-unit.source: You cannot back up virtual machines in one region to a backup vault in another region.
trans-unit.target: You cannot back up virtual machines in one region to a backup vault in another region.

trans-unit.source: So, you must create a backup vault in each Azure region, where there are VMs that will be backed up.
trans-unit.target: So, you must create a backup vault in each Azure region, where there are VMs that will be backed up.

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Discover Azure virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Discover Azure virtual machines

trans-unit.source: To ensure any new virtual machines (VMs) added to the subscription are identified before registering, run the discovery process.
trans-unit.target: To ensure any new virtual machines (VMs) added to the subscription are identified before registering, run the discovery process.

trans-unit.source: The process queries Azure for the list of virtual machines in the subscription, along with additional information like the cloud service name and the region.
trans-unit.target: The process queries Azure for the list of virtual machines in the subscription, along with additional information like the cloud service name and the region.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Classic portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Classic portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/)

trans-unit.source: In the list of Azure services , click **Recovery Services** to open the list of Backup and Site Recovery vaults.
trans-unit.target: In the list of Azure services , click **Recovery Services** to open the list of Backup and Site Recovery vaults.

trans-unit.source: ![Open vault list](./media/backup-azure-vms/choose-vault-list.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Open vault list](./media/backup-azure-vms/choose-vault-list.png)

trans-unit.source: In the list of Backup vaults, select the vault to back up a VM.
trans-unit.target: In the list of Backup vaults, select the vault to back up a VM.

trans-unit.source: If this is a new vault the portal opens to the **Quick Start** page.
trans-unit.target: If this is a new vault the portal opens to the **Quick Start** page.

trans-unit.source: Open Registered items menu
trans-unit.target: Open Registered items menu

trans-unit.source: If the vault has previously been configured, the portal opens to the most recently-used menu.
trans-unit.target: If the vault has previously been configured, the portal opens to the most recently-used menu.

trans-unit.source: From the vault menu (at the top of the page), click **Registered Items**.
trans-unit.target: From the vault menu (at the top of the page), click **Registered Items**.

trans-unit.source: Open Registered items menu
trans-unit.target: Open Registered items menu

trans-unit.source: From the **Type** menu, select **Azure Virtual Machine**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Type** menu, select **Azure Virtual Machine**.

trans-unit.source: Select workload
trans-unit.target: Select workload

trans-unit.source: Click **DISCOVER** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **DISCOVER** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![Discover button](./media/backup-azure-vms/discover-button-only.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Discover button](./media/backup-azure-vms/discover-button-only.png)

trans-unit.source: The discovery process may take a few minutes while the virtual machines are being tabulated.
trans-unit.target: The discovery process may take a few minutes while the virtual machines are being tabulated.

trans-unit.source: There is a notification at the bottom of the screen that lets you know that the process is running.
trans-unit.target: There is a notification at the bottom of the screen that lets you know that the process is running.

trans-unit.source: Discover VMs
trans-unit.target: Discover VMs

trans-unit.source: The notification changes when the process is complete.
trans-unit.target: The notification changes when the process is complete.

trans-unit.source: If the discovery process did not find the virtual machines, first ensure the VMs exist.
trans-unit.target: If the discovery process did not find the virtual machines, first ensure the VMs exist.

trans-unit.source: If the VMs exist, ensure the VMs are in the same region as the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: If the VMs exist, ensure the VMs are in the same region as the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: If the VMs exist and are in the same region, ensure the VMs are not already registered to a backup vault.
trans-unit.target: If the VMs exist and are in the same region, ensure the VMs are not already registered to a backup vault.

trans-unit.source: If a VMs is assigned to a backup vault it is not available to be assigned to other backup vaults.
trans-unit.target: If a VMs is assigned to a backup vault it is not available to be assigned to other backup vaults.

trans-unit.source: Discovery done
trans-unit.target: Discovery done

trans-unit.source: Once you have discovered the new items, go to Step 2 and register your VMs.
trans-unit.target: Once you have discovered the new items, go to Step 2 and register your VMs.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Register Azure virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Register Azure virtual machines

trans-unit.source: You register an Azure virtual machine to associate it with the Azure Backup service.
trans-unit.target: You register an Azure virtual machine to associate it with the Azure Backup service.

trans-unit.source: This is typically a one-time activity.
trans-unit.target: This is typically a one-time activity.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the backup vault under **Recovery Services** in the Azure portal, and then click **Registered Items**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the backup vault under **Recovery Services** in the Azure portal, and then click **Registered Items**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Azure Virtual Machine** from the drop-down menu.
trans-unit.target: Select **Azure Virtual Machine** from the drop-down menu.

trans-unit.source: Select workload
trans-unit.target: Select workload

trans-unit.source: Click **REGISTER** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **REGISTER** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![Register button](./media/backup-azure-vms/register-button-only.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Register button](./media/backup-azure-vms/register-button-only.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **Register Items** shortcut menu, select the virtual machines that you want to register.
trans-unit.target: In the **Register Items** shortcut menu, select the virtual machines that you want to register.

trans-unit.source: If there are two or more virtual machines with the same name, use the cloud service to distinguish between them.
trans-unit.target: If there are two or more virtual machines with the same name, use the cloud service to distinguish between them.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Multiple virtual machines can be registered at one time.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Multiple virtual machines can be registered at one time.

trans-unit.source: A job is created for each virtual machine that you've selected.
trans-unit.target: A job is created for each virtual machine that you've selected.

trans-unit.source: Click **View Job** in the notification to go to the **Jobs** page.
trans-unit.target: Click **View Job** in the notification to go to the **Jobs** page.

trans-unit.source: Register job
trans-unit.target: Register job

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine also appears in the list of registered items, along with the status of the registration operation.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine also appears in the list of registered items, along with the status of the registration operation.

trans-unit.source: Registering status 1
trans-unit.target: Registering status 1

trans-unit.source: When the operation completes, the status changes to reflect the *registered* state.
trans-unit.target: When the operation completes, the status changes to reflect the *registered* state.

trans-unit.source: Registration status 2
trans-unit.target: Registration status 2

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Protect Azure virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Protect Azure virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Now you can set up a backup and retention policy for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Now you can set up a backup and retention policy for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Multiple virtual machines can be protected by using a single protect action.
trans-unit.target: Multiple virtual machines can be protected by using a single protect action.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup vaults created after May 2015 come with a default policy built into the vault.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup vaults created after May 2015 come with a default policy built into the vault.

trans-unit.source: This default policy comes with a default retention of 30 days and a once-daily backup schedule.
trans-unit.target: This default policy comes with a default retention of 30 days and a once-daily backup schedule.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the backup vault under **Recovery Services** in the Azure portal, and then click **Registered Items**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the backup vault under **Recovery Services** in the Azure portal, and then click **Registered Items**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Azure Virtual Machine** from the drop-down menu.
trans-unit.target: Select **Azure Virtual Machine** from the drop-down menu.

trans-unit.source: Select workload in portal
trans-unit.target: Select workload in portal

trans-unit.source: Click **PROTECT** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **PROTECT** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: The **Protect Items wizard** appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Protect Items wizard** appears.

trans-unit.source: The wizard only lists virtual machines that are registered and not protected.
trans-unit.target: The wizard only lists virtual machines that are registered and not protected.

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machines that you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machines that you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: If there are two or more virtual machines with the same name, use the cloud service to distinguish between the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If there are two or more virtual machines with the same name, use the cloud service to distinguish between the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] You can protect multiple virtual machines at one time.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] You can protect multiple virtual machines at one time.

trans-unit.source: Configure protection at scale
trans-unit.target: Configure protection at scale

trans-unit.source: Choose a **backup schedule** to back up the virtual machines that you've selected.
trans-unit.target: Choose a **backup schedule** to back up the virtual machines that you've selected.

trans-unit.source: You can pick from an existing set of policies or define a new one.
trans-unit.target: You can pick from an existing set of policies or define a new one.

trans-unit.source: Each backup policy can have multiple virtual machines associated with it.
trans-unit.target: Each backup policy can have multiple virtual machines associated with it.

trans-unit.source: However, the virtual machine can only be associated with one policy at any given point in time.
trans-unit.target: However, the virtual machine can only be associated with one policy at any given point in time.

trans-unit.source: Protect with new policy
trans-unit.target: Protect with new policy

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A backup policy includes a retention scheme for the scheduled backups.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A backup policy includes a retention scheme for the scheduled backups.

trans-unit.source: If you select an existing backup policy, you cannot modify the retention options in the next step.
trans-unit.target: If you select an existing backup policy, you cannot modify the retention options in the next step.

trans-unit.source: Choose a **retention range** to associate with the backups.
trans-unit.target: Choose a **retention range** to associate with the backups.

trans-unit.source: Protect with flexible retention
trans-unit.target: Protect with flexible retention

trans-unit.source: Retention policy specifies the length of time for storing a backup.
trans-unit.target: Retention policy specifies the length of time for storing a backup.

trans-unit.source: You can specify different retention policies based on when the backup is taken.
trans-unit.target: You can specify different retention policies based on when the backup is taken.

trans-unit.source: For example, a backup point taken daily (which serves as an operational recovery point) might be preserved for 90 days.
trans-unit.target: For example, a backup point taken daily (which serves as an operational recovery point) might be preserved for 90 days.

trans-unit.source: In comparison, a backup point taken at the end of each quarter (for audit purposes) may need to be preserved for many months or years.
trans-unit.target: In comparison, a backup point taken at the end of each quarter (for audit purposes) may need to be preserved for many months or years.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine is backed up with recovery point
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine is backed up with recovery point

trans-unit.source: In this example image:
trans-unit.target: In this example image:

trans-unit.source: **Daily retention policy**: Backups taken daily are stored for 30 days.
trans-unit.target: **Daily retention policy**: Backups taken daily are stored for 30 days.

trans-unit.source: **Weekly retention policy**: Backups taken every week on Sunday are preserved for 104 weeks.
trans-unit.target: **Weekly retention policy**: Backups taken every week on Sunday are preserved for 104 weeks.

trans-unit.source: **Monthly retention policy**: Backups taken on the last Sunday of each month are preserved for 120 months.
trans-unit.target: **Monthly retention policy**: Backups taken on the last Sunday of each month are preserved for 120 months.

trans-unit.source: **Yearly retention policy**: Backups taken on the first Sunday of every January are preserved for 99 years.
trans-unit.target: **Yearly retention policy**: Backups taken on the first Sunday of every January are preserved for 99 years.

trans-unit.source: A job is created to configure the protection policy and associate the virtual machines to that policy for each virtual machine that you've selected.
trans-unit.target: A job is created to configure the protection policy and associate the virtual machines to that policy for each virtual machine that you've selected.

trans-unit.source: To view the list of **Configure Protection** jobs, from the vaults menu, click **Jobs** and select **Configure Protection** from the **Operation** filter.
trans-unit.target: To view the list of **Configure Protection** jobs, from the vaults menu, click **Jobs** and select **Configure Protection** from the **Operation** filter.

trans-unit.source: Configure protection job
trans-unit.target: Configure protection job

trans-unit.source: Initial backup
trans-unit.target: Initial backup

trans-unit.source: Once the virtual machine is protected with a policy, it shows up under the **Protected Items** tab with the status of *Protected - (pending initial backup)*.
trans-unit.target: Once the virtual machine is protected with a policy, it shows up under the **Protected Items** tab with the status of *Protected - (pending initial backup)*.

trans-unit.source: By default, the first scheduled backup is the *initial backup*.
trans-unit.target: By default, the first scheduled backup is the *initial backup*.

trans-unit.source: To trigger the initial backup immediately after configuring protection:
trans-unit.target: To trigger the initial backup immediately after configuring protection:

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the **Protected Items** page, click **Backup Now**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the **Protected Items** page, click **Backup Now**.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup service creates a backup job for the initial backup operation.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup service creates a backup job for the initial backup operation.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Jobs** tab to view the list of jobs.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Jobs** tab to view the list of jobs.

trans-unit.source: Backup in progress
trans-unit.target: Backup in progress

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] During the backup operation, the Azure Backup service issues a command to the backup extension in each virtual machine to flush all write jobs and take a consistent snapshot.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] During the backup operation, the Azure Backup service issues a command to the backup extension in each virtual machine to flush all write jobs and take a consistent snapshot.

trans-unit.source: When the initial backup finishes, the status of the virtual machine in the **Protected Items** tab is *Protected*.
trans-unit.target: When the initial backup finishes, the status of the virtual machine in the **Protected Items** tab is *Protected*.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine is backed up with recovery point
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine is backed up with recovery point

trans-unit.source: Viewing backup status and details
trans-unit.target: Viewing backup status and details

trans-unit.source: Once protected, the virtual machine count also increases in the **Dashboard** page summary.
trans-unit.target: Once protected, the virtual machine count also increases in the **Dashboard** page summary.

trans-unit.source: The **Dashboard** page also shows the number of jobs from the last 24 hours that were *successful*, have *failed*, and are *in progress*.
trans-unit.target: The **Dashboard** page also shows the number of jobs from the last 24 hours that were *successful*, have *failed*, and are *in progress*.

trans-unit.source: On the **Jobs** page, use the **Status**, **Operation**, or **From** and **To** menus to filter the jobs.
trans-unit.target: On the **Jobs** page, use the **Status**, **Operation**, or **From** and **To** menus to filter the jobs.

trans-unit.source: Status of backup in Dashboard page
trans-unit.target: Status of backup in Dashboard page

trans-unit.source: Values in the dashboard are refreshed once every 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: Values in the dashboard are refreshed once every 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting errors
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting errors

trans-unit.source: If you run into issues while backing up your virtual machine, look at the [VM troubleshooting article](backup-azure-vms-troubleshoot.md) for help.
trans-unit.target: If you run into issues while backing up your virtual machine, look at the [VM troubleshooting article](backup-azure-vms-troubleshoot.md) for help.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Manage and monitor your virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Manage and monitor your virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Restore virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Restore virtual machines
